alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Dale and northwestern Houston Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 413 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms extending from 8 miles east of Ozark to near Pinckard. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Ozark, Dothan, Fort Rucker, Midland City, Newton, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Grimes, Napier Field, Hunt Field, Waterford, Knox Field, Mabson, Ewell, Cairns Aaf, Dale County Lake, Sylvan Grove, Echo and Dean Church Road. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
